How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dataing apps: namely, the incessant and pe

It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the problems they have with social perforamce are not lying to mnake thwemselves more attrac

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the problems they have with social perforamce are not lying to mnake thwemselves more attractive, but ratyhert ta,kiong a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be eq

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the problems they have with social perforamce are not lying to mnake thwemselves more attractive, but ratyhert ta,kiong a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally hones. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the problems they have with social perforamce are not lying to mnake thwemselves more attractive, but ratyhert ta,kiong a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally hones. How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who desiribe the problems they have with social perforamce are not lying to mnake thwemselves more attractive, but ratyhert ta,kiong a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally hones. There is no socil uopside in desciving the difiiculties you have in meeting or talking to peop

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frihghtened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a b

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other f.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat ma.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be sdrawn too.

Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. WIn fact, w might say online dating is democratic in this way: empowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

Peopel may flame ot harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards make it m

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-meetit much safer than physical meetings.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meit much safer than physical meetings.

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful,.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. .

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or of not like them, others who understand and accept them. Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with.

It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Interestingly, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and at the same time, there is no negative impact in saying you have difficulties unless the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who undert.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---
Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, and but there si an  the other person has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who understand.

Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person yohas a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon other folks in the same boat may see and be drawn too. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who understand.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---
Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person you meet has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who understand.

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person you meet has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who understand.

This use of dating apps to empower

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---
Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person you meet has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---
Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person you meet has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to. In fact, w might say online dating is democratic in tmpowering the lonely and socially awkward to be honest about themselves without fear of negative social fallout
.

People may flame or harass others on a dating app, or course, but built-in safeguards app-mediated meetings much safer than physical ones. Online dating is where the socially fearless mingle with the socially fearful, and the fearful can find solace with others who understand.

How Do You Think Technology Affects Dating?

Have you had any experience with dating? Have you ever used dating apps? If so, what has it been like for you? If not, why not?

How do you think technology — like apps, Netflix, social media and texting — affects dating and relationships? In your opinion, does it improve or worsen romantic interactions? How so?

---
Technology helps people feel less shy when it comes to approaching the person they are interested in. It is easier to send that message of introduction or contact on apps and websites than in person.

Online dating has made it possible for the introverted or less socially skilled to meet others like them, or if not like them, can at least understand and accept them. 

In fact, the use of online dating by the socially unskilled overcomes one of the chief problems with dating apps: namely, the incessant and pervasive lying. Users who describe the problems they have with social performance are not lying to make themselves more attractive, but rather taking a risk in the hope of attracting someone who can be equally honest. There is no social upside in describing the difficulties you have in meeting or talking to people, unless the person you meet has a hard time too.

Wen people describe themselves as athletic, athletic-minded, adventurous or intellectual, this may be a lself-promoting ie . Saying one is frightened, lonely or shy, however is more a beacon then a boast: a beacon others in the same boat may see and be drawn to.
